channel.title: Geminus
channel.description:
I'm not entirely sure why the other topic was locked. I understand this section is for advertising, and I'm advertising for Geminus.
Sorry for the spam.
Just would like to point something out that I pointed out awhile back when the third stork was around (lol).
Who cares who's source code we're using? The FIRST private server, was Geminus.
Therefore, we aren't using "havok" source, or "demonik" source or even "RSCA" source. Everything is based off of Geminus.
That's my two cents. Aren't we all in this to make private servers better, and more stable?
Why are we trying to shut down other servers when players want to actually play on it? Personally my favorite was the server that Stork ran himself before getting into trouble with Jagex (circa 2005? I'm not sure). Back then we didn't have owners DDoSing other servers in hopes to increase their player base.
On another note, when there is hear say that a certain owner had the DDoSing occur, what does it tell you about how they go about things? Personally, I will never play on a server who has to DDoS in order to get players.
That's my two cents. Thoughts? And once again, sorry for it being the wrong section (is there even a section for this kind of thing?)

item.title: Geminus
item.dc:creator: @hm_wtf_lol_xD hm wtf lol xD
item.description:
@hm_wtf_lol_xD wrote:

[quote=“dragonlord, post:17, topic:371810”][quote author=mapu link=topic=467878.msg3422575#msg3422575 date=1291629256]
I can’t help but correct you on almost everything you said (for the newbies).

[quote author=dragonlord link=topic=467878.msg3420725#msg3420725 date=1291494254]

Who cares who’s source code we’re using? The FIRST private server, was Geminus. [/quote]
No

[quote author=dragonlord link=topic=467878.msg3420725#msg3420725 date=1291494254]
Everything is based off of Geminus. [/quote]
no

[quote author=dragonlord link=topic=467878.msg3420725#msg3420725 date=1291494254]
That’s my two cents. Aren’t we all in this to make private servers better, and more stable? [/quote]
no

The one’s up now are in it for 15 minutes of fame and a few dollars.

Back then we didn’t have owners DDoSing other servers in hopes to increase their player base. [/quote]
no

The DDoS was just as bad during stork days.

Sorry, the first private server was based off Geminus.

If Geminus never came about, would we be as far into RSC development as we are? No, therefore, code and ideas for code is based off Geminus.

People have been wanting a team to be put together to make an amazing server. Just because a few don’t, doesn’t mean we all don’t. But I see where you’re coming from. I’ll correct my statement to: Aren’t most of us in this to make servers better.

And the bad DDoSing didn’t start until after the second stork was shut down, i.e. DDoSing to shut down servers, not just lag them.[/quote]

You live in lala land, Nuff said Geminus was not the first runescape classic private server at ALL there was plenty before that by baka and sliab and etc… There was even a private server for the engine of 174 (I remember that). You sir are just a kid trying to act like all knowledge is on your shoulders… You do not no anything what went on in them days nor will you get a team with to work with you

Why work on a really unstable source like Geminus when it will take you around 1-2 days to write a server using a API netty or mina… Saying that you most likely do not have the knowledge… Catalyst is programmed poorly for a netty server but that is what you expect from people who try dive deep into it with little knowledge of the API… Nuff said this post is useless so are you.

Read full topic

item.title: Geminus
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

[quote=“dragonlord, post:10, topic:371810”]Everything you say is true. Let’s take a step back. Way back. Back to the days of Aryan.

Aryan was totally open source. It had a VPN, and all the coders would upload and document changes they made. Aryan was a HUGE success (and it just so happens to still be as far as I know, not into RS2 anymore).

Let’s say we do something like this. Would it work? Absolutely. Do people want to do it? No. Because they’re selfish.[/quote]

It has already been done in the classic scene. We are at the point of development where we really need to grind down on the stability of the server and making everything as efficient as possible. If this community were to put their minds together I think Catalyst Would be the best bet.

Its not that people are selfish. Everyone in the classic community has released something. Its the fact that we only have about 4 people here who know what they are doing and are doing it properly.

Read full topic

item.title: Geminus
item.dc:creator: @dragonlord dragonlord
item.description:
@dragonlord wrote:

[quote=“IlikeArrays, post:8, topic:371810”]I know its a great idea to have the whole community work on one server and I support that. One website that we can all work together would be great. However, it is unrealistic. Another problem with your post is going back to Geminus. Who wants to go back in development? Not to mention the fact you want servers to shutdown just so we can work on one great server. Who would want to shut down their server? Alot of effort and time has already been put into these servers and you just want people to stop what they are doing and quit. I can only think of two people who can come here to this community and make an announcement saying we are working on this project, right now. Everyone shutdown their servers and actually have people follow the project. Those two people have more knowledge then any of us and could do the project on their own with no help. Now if you want to get a bunch of beginner developers to work on something your going to need to…

  1. Make a project outline, what needs to be done? How is it going to be done? Whats the due dates? Who is doing what? Who is doing the website, the php, the server sided development, the client sided development, the moderation. Who gets control of the dedi? Do we all get control of the dedi or only specific people? Who gets access to the source? Is it open sourced? Why would it be opened source? I dont want leechers, do you want leechers?

Its all good to make one big project for everybody but at the end of the day you will only have yourself and maybe one or two others who are interested but lack the knowledge to get started.[/quote]

Everything you say is true. Let’s take a step back. Way back. Back to the days of Aryan.

Aryan was totally open source. It had a VPN, and all the coders would upload and document changes they made. Aryan was a HUGE success (and it just so happens to still be as far as I know, not into RS2 anymore).

Let’s say we do something like this. Would it work? Absolutely. Do people want to do it? No. Because they’re selfish.

Read full topic

item.title: Geminus
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

I know its a great idea to have the whole community work on one server and I support that. One website that we can all work together would be great. However, it is unrealistic. Another problem with your post is going back to Geminus. Who wants to go back in development? Not to mention the fact you want servers to shutdown just so we can work on one great server. Who would want to shut down their server? Alot of effort and time has already been put into these servers and you just want people to stop what they are doing and quit. I can only think of two people who can come here to this community and make an announcement saying we are working on this project, right now. Everyone shutdown their servers and actually have people follow the project. Those two people have more knowledge then any of us and could do the project on their own with no help. Now if you want to get a bunch of beginner developers to work on something your going to need to…

  1. Make a project outline, what needs to be done? How is it going to be done? Whats the due dates? Who is doing what? Who is doing the website, the php, the server sided development, the client sided development, the moderation. Who gets control of the dedi? Do we all get control of the dedi or only specific people? Who gets access to the source? Is it open sourced? Why would it be opened source? I dont want leechers, do you want leechers?

Its all good to make one big project for everybody but at the end of the day you will only have yourself and maybe one or two others who are interested but lack the knowledge to get started.

Read full topic

item.description:
@dragonlord wrote:

yong min:

This isn’t actually advertising a public/active server, so I believe it would be better placed within the discussion section? http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/board,52.0.html

I understand that, but I wanted to let the people looking for a new server to see what’s going on around here. Specifically, the administration of RSCE.
